Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting hindquarters of possibly a dog, to right; elaborate rosette, palmette and pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Hounds are very rarely depicted on vases in the Mature Animal Style For parallels regarding the large palmette, see British Museum 1888,0601.471.m.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 257, no. 474, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0543) (phase 2)
